metadata.title: CVE-2015-5276 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: The std::random_device class in libstdc++ in the GNU Compiler Collection(aka GCC) before 4.9.4 does not properly handle short reads from blockingsources, which makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to predictthe random values via unspecified vectors.

criterions.comment: gcc-4.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
